title.narrative: Integrated lifesaving nutrition services for crisis-affected children and women in East Aleppo

description.narrative:
The nutrition sector needs the funds to fill in the gap for the current interventions for eastern Aleppo where a Rapid nutrition screening carried out in the camps 23,203 children under five and pregnant lactating women for acute malnutrition. Around 130 people were identified with acute malnutrition who were provided with treatment. To date, 23,203 women and children have been screened through the Mid-Upper Arm Circumference (MUAC) measurement for malnutrition of which 990 (640 children under five and 290 pregnant and lactating women) were identified with acute malnutrition and are receiving nutrition treatment. The nutrition sector has secured supplies for the nutrition intervention for two months. The procurement of additional therapeutic and preventative nutrition supplies will avert what was expected to be a break in the pipeline of these life-saving supplies, ensuring a continuity of health and nutrition services for this highly vulnerable population in Eastern Aleppo.
In the case of pregnant and lactating women, UNICEF is capitalizing on the supply provision to provide complementary IYCF counselling, a central intervention in the prevention of malnutrition As UNICEF is the sector lead and the last resort nutrition is a sector priority. UNICEF will target all the areas in the eastern part of Aleppo city. The mobile clinic procurement was cancelled due to considerable constraints caused by the Ministry of Health and customs to import the clinic and the shifting situation in Eastern Aleppo, it was agreed with OCHA that the funds would be used on a faster, and more sustainable local procurement of three mobile clinics. After moving forward with local procurement of three mobile clinics, it was found that obtaining the required approvals from the concerned accountable parties would also not be possible within the project duration. All the beneficiaries will be from the eastern side of Aleppo for internally displaced population.
